title: How do we find if a compound is paramagnetic or diamagnetic? - Quora

response.answer_text: Paramagnetic substances:-substances which have unpaired electrons are called paramagnetic substances Diamagnetic substance:-substances which have paired electrons. How to find out magnetic character in atoms?  How to find out magnetic character in molecules?

Experimentally by finding out whether the substance is attracted towards the magnetic field (para magnetic), or repelled by the magnetic field(diamagnetic). If you know the electronic conifign. of the ‘d’ levels of the central metal atom in the complex, if there is unpaired electron-paamagnetic, if all the levels are filled with paired electrons-diamagnetic.

The magnetic properties of asubstance can be determined by examining its electron configuration:If it has unpaired electrons, then thesubstance is paramagnetic and if all electrons are paired, the substance is then diamagnetic. ... Determine whether the substance is paramagnetic or diamagnetic.

Those substances are repel by a magnetic field is called diamagnetic substances. Those substances are weakly attracted by a magnetic field is called paramagnetic substances.Paramagnetic behavier is due to the persence of unpaired electrons.  If the substances have unpaired election then it is called paramagnetic substances.Diamagnetic character is due to absence of unpaired electrons.

Those substances are repail by a magnet is called diamagnetic substances. Those substances are weakly attracted by a magnet is called paramagnetic substances. If the substances have unpaired election then it is called paramagnetic substances. If all the electrons are getting paired then it is called diamagnetic substances. It is also known for its electronic confugaration.
When a compound contains unpaired electrons in thr central atom then the compound is paramagnetic. If it does not contains any unpaired electrons then it is diamagnetic.
